segment.source: Exercise 1 - Assess the Device's Audio Latency Performance for Communications Scenarios
segment.target: Exercise 1 - Assess the Device's Audio Latency Performance for Communications Scenarios

segment.source: In this exercise, we’ll run the following matrix of audio latency tests that generate latency stats for various latency modes supported in Windows.
segment.target: In this exercise, we’ll run the following matrix of audio latency tests that generate latency stats for various latency modes supported in Windows.

segment.source: Exercise 1 - Assess the Device's Audio Latency Performance for Communications Scenarios
segment.target: Exercise 1 - Assess the Device's Audio Latency Performance for Communications Scenarios

segment.source: In this exercise, we’ll run the following matrix of audio latency tests that generate latency stats for various latency modes supported in Windows.
segment.target: In this exercise, we’ll run the following matrix of audio latency tests that generate latency stats for various latency modes supported in Windows.

segment.source: The modes that the test can be run in include:
segment.target: The modes that the test can be run in include:

segment.source: Default mode – Generates default out-of-box audio latency.
segment.target: Default mode – Generates default out-of-box audio latency.

segment.source: Raw mode – Removes Audio Processing Objects (APOs).
segment.target: Raw mode – Removes Audio Processing Objects (APOs).

segment.source: Low Period – New low latency mode for near real-time scenarios such as Skype.
segment.target: Low Period – New low latency mode for near real-time scenarios such as Skype.

segment.source: The test renders test sounds that are captured by the microphone.
segment.target: The test renders test sounds that are captured by the microphone.

segment.source: Note This step-by-step guide is also available to view as a lab video on Channel 9, which features videos for developers from the people building Microsoft Products and Services: https://channel9.msdn.com/Events/WinHEC/2015/OWDHOL301
segment.target: Note This step-by-step guide is also available to view as a lab video on Channel 9, which features videos for developers from the people building Microsoft Products and Services: https://channel9.msdn.com/Events/WinHEC/2015/OWDHOL301

segment.source: Step 1: Prepare the system to run the tests
segment.target: Step 1: Prepare the system to run the tests

segment.source: Install the Hardware Lab Kit (HLK) controller.
segment.target: Install the Hardware Lab Kit (HLK) controller.

segment.source: Right-click on the Start menu and click on Command Prompt (Admin).
segment.target: Right-click on the Start menu and click on Command Prompt (Admin).

segment.source: Navigate to the controller-nameTestsprocessor architectureTE folder.
segment.target: Navigate to the controller-nameTestsprocessor architectureTE folder.

segment.source: Copy the following tests and tools from the Hardware Lab Kit (HLK) controller to your test machine in: C:PerformanceMedia
segment.target: Copy the following tests and tools from the Hardware Lab Kit (HLK) controller to your test machine in: C:PerformanceMedia

segment.source: controller-nameTestsprocessor architecturenttestmultimediatestwmmftestglitchfreetaeftests.dll
segment.target: controller-nameTestsprocessor architecturenttestmultimediatestwmmftestglitchfreetaeftests.dll

segment.source: controller-nameTaefBinariesprocessor architecture
segment.target: controller-nameTaefBinariesprocessor architecture

segment.source: controller-nameTestsprocessor architecturePerformanceWindowsXRaytoolsEtwPattern.dll
segment.target: controller-nameTestsprocessor architecturePerformanceWindowsXRaytoolsEtwPattern.dll

segment.source: controller-nameTestsprocessor architecturetestMediaEngineTest.exe
segment.target: controller-nameTestsprocessor architecturetestMediaEngineTest.exe

segment.source: controller-nameTestsprocessor architectureaudio-testbinaudiospew.exe
segment.target: controller-nameTestsprocessor architectureaudio-testbinaudiospew.exe

segment.source: controller-nameTestsprocessor architectureaudio-testbinaudiostreaming.dll
segment.target: controller-nameTestsprocessor architectureaudio-testbinaudiostreaming.dll

segment.source: controller-nameTestsprocessor architecturenttestmultimediatestwmmftestrws.exe
segment.target: controller-nameTestsprocessor architecturenttestmultimediatestwmmftestrws.exe

segment.source: controller-nameTestsprocessor architecturenttestmultimediatestwmmftestaudio-fidelity-stress.xml
segment.target: controller-nameTestsprocessor architecturenttestmultimediatestwmmftestaudio-fidelity-stress.xml

segment.source: controller-nameTestsprocessor architectureaudio-testbinLatencyTest.dll
segment.target: controller-nameTestsprocessor architectureaudio-testbinLatencyTest.dll

segment.source: Set the volume level on the speakers to 100%.
segment.target: Set the volume level on the speakers to 100%.

segment.target: Step 2: Run the test in default mode

segment.target: Run the following command:

segment.target: View the Average, Max, and Min delay values that are sent to the command prompt window.

segment.target: Step 3: Run the test in raw mode
